src.storage.implementations package¶

Submodules¶

src.storage.implementations.FolderFilerManager module¶

Module contains the manager for a local folder and methods that it should implement as a generic FileManager. Buffer size for I/O operations is also set here.

class src.storage.implementations.FolderFilerManager.FolderFileManager(conn_string: str)[source]¶

Bases: FileManager

File Manager implementation for a local folder.

close(fd: BinaryIO) → None[source]¶

Closes the specified file via file descriptor.

Parameters¶

fdBinaryIO

File descriptor to be closed.

create_dir(path_data: tuple)[source]¶

Creates a dir at specified relative path

Parameters¶

path_datatuple

Relative path where the dir should be created, usually extracted from PathData object.

get_files_metadata() → dict[source]¶

Gets the metadata of all files and folders in the current storage location.

Parses the information about the files and folders and creates a common format, so they can be used in sync algorithm.

Returns¶

dict

Metadata stored with PathData object as key and modification date as value (if necessary, None otherwise)

mkdirs(dirs: list[str]) → None[source]¶

Creates a specified dir sequence from root.

Silently ignores the case when one or more dirs exist, creating only the necessary ones.

Parameters¶

dirslist

Sequence of dirs to be created (starting from root).

open(path_data: tuple, mode='r')[source]¶

Opens the specified file in the specified mode.

Typically, mode is mapped to the binary equivalent for support between different storage types reasons.

Parameters¶

path_datalist

Relative path where the file to be deleted is located, usually extracted from PathData object.

modeLiteral

Specifies the mode in which the file should be opened, typically mapped to binary equivalent

Returns¶

BinaryIO

The descriptor of the file to be used in different operations

refresh()[source]¶

Refreshes the content of the storage location.

Created as an extension that permits different actions between iterations of sync algorithm. Currently, used for zip only.

remove_dir(path_data: tuple)[source]¶

Removes a dir at specified relative path

Parameters¶

path_datatuple

Relative path where the dir to be deleted is located, usually extracted from PathData object.

remove_file(path_data: tuple)[source]¶

Removes the specified file by relative path.

Parameters¶

path_datalist

Relative path where the file to be deleted is located, usually extracted from PathData object.

retrieve_file(path_data, fd_dest)[source]¶

Writes file specified to the destination descriptor.

Parameters¶

path_datatuple

Relative path to the file, usually extracted from PathData object.

fd_destBinaryIO

File descriptor of the destination.

save_file(path_data: tuple, fd_source)[source]¶

Writes file specified to the storage location of current FileManager.

Parameters¶

path_datatuple

Relative path where the file should be created, usually extracted from PathData object.

fd_sourceBinaryIO

File descriptor of the source.

setup()[source]¶

Initial setup or any sort of arranging

src.storage.implementations.FtpFileManager module¶

Module contains the manager for a ftp folder and methods that it should implement as a generic FileManager. Default port, path separator and default timeout is also set here.

class src.storage.implementations.FtpFileManager.FtpFileManager(conn_string)[source]¶

Bases: FileManager

src.storage.implementations.ZipFileManager module¶

Module contains the manager for a zip file and methods that it should implement as a generic FileManager. Buffer size for I/O operations, separator for paths and tmp file for refreshing the zip is also set here.

class src.storage.implementations.ZipFileManager.ZipFileManager(conn_string: str)[source]¶

Bases: FileManager

File Manager implementation for a zip file.

static to_millis_from_epoch(date_time: tuple) → float[source]¶

Module contents¶

Package for implementations of FileManager. Currently, supporting local folder file manager, ftp file manager and zip file manager with methods for manipulating files and folders, obtainining their modification date and structure of the whole storage location in a common format.
